poem:
**Morning Headlines**

The sun rises again over distant lands,  
where rockets trace lines in the sky,  
and numbers stack like forgotten faces.  
The ink bleeds on paper—tragedy in print—  
and somewhere, doves sit silently,  
awaiting a moment to catch the wind  
and break the sky with their flight.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Middle East crisis live: Macron calls for end to fighting in Lebanon and criticises Israel incursion 11.00am BST Israel’s military has reported that 95 rockets have been launched aimed at Israel from inside southern Lebanon so far today. 10.49am BST The Hamas-led health authority in Gaza has issued new casualty figures from the conflict, claiming that 42,847 Palestinians have been killed and 100,544 wounded in Gaza since Israel launched its military offensive last year. It". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
